text: Love this stuff, never going back. But, as you replace your cat box, if at all possible, do it outside. This is not dustproof. You'll  be dusting nearby items. After the initial filling, it's  great. I scoop her box every night and wipe wet spots down with a neutralize and replace lost sand. So, this item can last and control order for a long time- maybe up to a month, with my routine. Awesome! Because who likes cleaning a litter box anyway? And who would leave poop in their own toilet?? Ew.I can't  really comment on litter tracking because she is very thorough about her paw wiping- good girl!Side note: I fill mine kind of deep so she can FULLY bury.  Even aside from the daily scoop and neutralizer, I find that sand depth makes a HUGE difference for odor control. Yes, initially it cost a little more to do that but in the long run? It lasts longer, works better and you actually save money.** PLEASE, provide a LID COVERED, privacy cat box,  kitty will love you for it! Same as you, kitty prefers not to pottie in front of housemates!
